content.p: Thinking about your career, applying for jobs, and being at work can be exciting and rewarding, but sometimes these activities can also present challenges and might be a source of stress or anxiety. So, we’re here to help you to navigate any issues. Nobody has lived your life but you. It is easy to get caught up in comparing yourself to others and therefore convincing yourself you will never be able to achieve what they have. Rebecca Smith, pharmacy student Read Rebecca's blog post This online hub focuses on some of the things that might cause you concern and provides helpful advice, alongside ‘how to...’ resources that will guide you through useful techniques you can try for yourself, and forums so that you can share reflections with others. Dip in wherever you wish or complete the NOOC as a Nottingham Advantage Award module. Go to the Career Wellbeing NOOC Posts delve into specific challenges and provide practical advice, as well as ideas and inspiration to support your career wellbeing. Go to our wellbeing blog posts Here you will find tips to help you to stay positive when thinking about your future and be kind to yourself when making applications. Go to our online guide, begin! Go to begin! We can help you to work through any challenges and suggest helpful approaches that will enable you to make progress and feel positive. Chat with one of our team telephone: +44 (0) 115 951 3680 fax: +44 (0) 115 951 3679 email: careers-team@nottingham.ac.uk
